Reviews.Title: “Exactly like the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: iamboring
Reviews.Content: Riders lodge is exactly like what the other reviews say: 1. Not-so-clean sheets and towels (stains) 2. Location wise far from town and not very accessible 3. Turf city is nearby but with very few shops 4. Dogs barking in the morning 5. Service isn't wonderful 6. Breakfast was very simple A good place if you need somewhere cheap to stay but if you have the $ choose somewhere else. I enjoyed my stay though due to the company. :D

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Author: lenny37
Reviews.Content: The riders lodge is better off as a holiday chalet or bunglow in my opinion. The rooms had a stale smell and had no windows. The free wifi did not work well, the signals were weak. I asked for a room change vut was turned down. Management is aware of tne problem but choose not to do anything about it. Location far to city. Long walk to bustop. Taxis do not come in frequently. Breakfast was terrible. No shops within walking distance Dogs barking in the morning. No porter service Avoid this place if u can

Reviews.Title: “Close to nature”
Reviews.Author: wennyow
Reviews.Content: stayed twice. A good change from the usual urban hotels in town. Experience with checkin and checkout were both pleasant. Rooms are quite alright. But do note they are quite dated but clean with a musty smell. Might not be acceptable to all. Breakfast is.. well.. i'll opt to skip the one provided and walk over to picotin for one.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: drql
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the less expensive hotels we could find online. It's like a Best Western I suppose. Not fancy but comfortable and clean enough. It's a little "far" from city center so yes you do need a taxi to get around. But Singapore is so small that each taxi ride doesn't really cost much. The staff were very nice and helpful. Just two reminders: 1. Typically you just need to stand on the road and wave for a taxi. But if you need to go to the airport from this hotel, ask the hotel staff if they can call a taxi for you. Otherwise you could wait outside for a while and get anxious. 2. If you get up early and wander around, you may see (lots of) monkeys.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic accommodation by the stables”
Reviews.Author: nem048
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days, hotel is far from the city centre and taxis a must to get to & fro hotel. Cons- rooms quite basic & small, bathroom with basic shower & limited hot water, sink with only cold water, even though rooms were cleaned daily, the towels & bedsheets were worn & pillow cases stained. Early morning woken up by dogs constantly barking, though seeing monkeys on the trees nearby was a novelty. Breakfast was unexciting- basic for western type food though served cold for most food Pros- Nearby french cafe restaurant Picotin served great pizzas; Overall ok for short stays if you want to be away from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere, good location”
Reviews.Author: kay082011
Reviews.Content: Overall, the location was ideal for travellers who want to stay away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. This means you will have a taxi ride of approx $10 to downtown. The hotel itself is rustic almost like a cottage setting. Very peaceful with trees around and birds waking you up. The cleaning service was poor - forgetting to put towels and toilet paper, not cleaning the room and washroom properly and the way the bathroom is set up the entire floor gets soaked in the process of taking a shower. Needs major work to equate to North American standards. The breakfast is not good for people on special diets - too much fried food and rice and pasta. Needs to be more diversified if it is to be considered breakfast. The management staff are friedly and they work hard to ensure your requests are met but there is little cohesion between the different staff on duty. You make a request to one and they forget to pass the information on to the other. Generally, a quiet and relaxing atmosphere. Needs improvement to make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel. Cleanliness, service and breakfast needs much improvement”
Reviews.Author: AW_LK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks to settle into singapore upon arriving for the first time in the country to start new employment. Location is a good 30-45 mins from town by bus on a good day. Checking in was difficult as communication proved tricky to understand. The person who checked us in turned out to be an unhelpful obnoxious character. The door lock to our room appeared to be from the dark ages and barely worth the name as lock. The travel of the locking bolt into the catch was about 5mm and appeared to be able to be broken open by a sneeze. They tried in vain to remedy this with my assistance taking bits off other doors. No other suitable rooms were available except for dark windowless boxes. Cleaning staff did very little cleaning of our rooms. Bed sheets not changed for days. Bathroom dank and wet whenever we showered resulting in water all over the floor. Breakfast was appaling. Fish fingers, chicken nuggets, rice, samosas, cocktail sausages, over boiled eggs, mash of goo resembling noodles. Simply horrible. We resorted to having only toast and some passable juice. We made our own coffee. When it rained water covered the floor of the upper level titled corridor. It was like walking on ice at times. Our advice. Choose somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfotable place away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: peritwinkle_11
Reviews.Content: I would say that i absolutely enjoyed my stay in this place.The hotel architecture resembled a cozy cottage house but it is actually a 41 room hotel.The reception area was small but nicely "put-together" with big black lounge chairs and a mini-shelf that contained maps about the sights and sounds in singapore. The staff was friendly and accomodating. They really made an effort to ensure that we had a good stay in the hotel.The room was actually more spacious than we thought, actually the pictures do not give it much justice. The space is a definite advantage because despite the presence our baggage and shopping bags it was not difficult to move around at all.The room was clean and tidy. Also, well aircondtioned.Each room is provided with a flat-screen TV with cable that you can watch free of charge!.So you get to still enjoy your favorite movies from star movies,hbo,etc. The bathroom was of adequate size with a toilet and shower equipped with shampoo,soap and shower gel dispenser. The breakfast buffet was an unexpected delight. Every morning they would change menus and we were treated with various delectable singaporean dishes that were of american, chinese and indian origin. The only disadvantage i could probably say was the hotel's location.It is FAR from the city. It is actually a 20-30 min cab ride from City Central Actually most cab drivers have a hard time finding the place. If you would ever want to stay here you should tell the driver to go to bukit timah near turf city where horsecity is and viola! I have no qualms in recommending this place to my family and friends who would go to singapore.I would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: MiaLillooet
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny,it reminded of a college dormitory with two twin beds and a tiny window. The other rooms might be nicer, I don't know. The bathroom was sub-standard. There is no hot water at the basin, the bathroom was not cleaned properly and it left a bad impression. There is no hair-dryer, I had to request one from reception and phoned twice before it arrived. For elderly people: there is no elevator, so you have to carry your bags to the room,which are all upstairs. The room is being promoted as colonial style with stunning views??? I can not agree. It might have the potential, but the current management is not doing enough to enhance that. It is in the middle of nowhere and there is really nothing to it. It is badly signposted and the taxi driver had difficulty finding it. There is wi-fi internet available. I did not have a laptop, but the manager kindly agreed that I may use the computer in his office, . The hotel has a surcharge of $2.50 to book a taxi for

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: atraveller2011189458
Reviews.Content: In Summary: Costly to reach & requires taxis to go anywhere. Room with no window or only 6" wide window right by the door. Aircon which will take an average hour to get room down to selected temp as fan speed inadequate. Unhelpful & uninterested staff at reception. Clean basic room (hotels classification deluxe). Basic amenities included (tea/coffee, air-con, deposit box). Minibar available at extra cost but resonably priced. We chose this hotel away from the city in order to have a nice view & quiet stay. The taxi cost 28$S in rush hour and the hotel location is not great because there is no MRT station or transport nearby so you have to use taxis to get everywhere. On arrival reception/hotel is not accesible directly from the car so you have to pull your suitcases uphill & along a paved path (not easy) for short distance approx 20m. Our room was then upstairs (no lift / porter or assistance). The 'receptionist' was not particularly polite or helpful although not rude at check-in. The room was clean with kettle tea & coffee included. Minibar available at reasonable rates. Room was extremely disappointing. The hotel's descriptions state "rooms overlooking scenic views". The views are not particularly scenic & you don't have a window to look out of anyway unless you you count a 6" wide slit of a window by the door. Overall I'd score it 1 out of 5 because it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: RoamingKiwi_11
Reviews.Content: The reviews on Trip Advisor generally seemed positive - a nice lodge style hotel in a semi rural setting. Overall I was disappointed with my experience. I turned up at about 7am as my flight from NZ landed very early (about 5:30am). The lady on the front desk gave me a look of "what are you doing here?" when I showed up hot and sweaty with my luggage. Not welcoming at all. Being jet lagged I tried to get some sleep in the morning but this was difficult as the cleaners are extremely noisy. They seemed to spend all their time yelling at each other (including a man, perhaps the overall boss of the cleaning and housekeeping staff, who kept on saying "now listen to me, this is how should be doing it" very loudly!). My room was very basic, you might even say budget. The breakfast was very very average. I expected a nice retreat. I got a very basic hotel, with noisy housekeeping staff, which is in the middle of nowhere and awkward to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Away from all tourist spots, yet so pricey”
Reviews.Author: Rakesh37
Reviews.Content: Rooms: I got myself a Grandeur room with a King size bed. It has a big 32’ LCD TV. Room is reasonably big while Bathroom does not have a bath tub. The room also has got a very small window and of course there is no balcony (I guess it is with Suites only). If you love to look out of your room, pls ask for rooms with double window when you reserve. WiFi Internet access is free and that is a big plus. Big windows would have earned rooms 1 more star from me. It does have a mini refrigerator as well. Iron and ironing board, travel adaptors are available upon request. Late check out/ early check in are allowed subject to availability at no extra cost Restaurant: Does not have any of its own. But they do serve breakfast for free. Limited items but taste is good and breakfast is sufficient. As for lunch/ dinner, there is a French restaurant (Picotin) in the same campus, most haunted by locals, so one can try that (min S$60 for 3 course meal) . Else, about 300 meters away you have plenty of restaurants/ bars (including 2 Indian restaurants) on sixth avenue. Room Rates: Reasonably priced. But do try to call hotel for discounts before booking. (Rack rates are much higher than what you book at) Proximity: No MRT nearby but there is one coming up in year 2014. Bus stop is 250 meters away from where you can find buses to nearest MRT or even Orchard Road. Interestingly the place has direct link by bus to major shopping areas besides Orchard like Boon Lay, Bukit Timah, Clementi besides those who have work in NUS Kent Bridge, there is a direct connection too. There is a supermarket (Cold Storage) nearby as well. In the hotel compound, there is a famous but expensive Spa as well. If going by taxi, please tell driver that you have to go near horsecity opposite sixth avenue on Bukit Timah Road because this place/ hotel is not well known among the cabbies. Verdict: The hotel is in a compound where besides hotel there is a Montessori, a French restaurant, a Spa besides a horse turf and a dog compound. At the rate being offered and the access to various places, I have all praise for this hotel. A hotel that could have completed the 5 star rating if limitations are addressed. Plus: Rooms, location, internet access (if it works) Minus: Maintenance staff works at their own leisure. I could not access internet at one point in time and it made me call them almost 6 times and they took 5 days to correct the problem. Upon check out when I asked for discount on account of internet issue, I was told that since it was for free so no discounts. I hope someday they should not come n say “today no breakfast” and since it is also for free so hardly as a guest we can do . No choice in cable channels. No Hindi channel. Paid parking at S$1/hr during day time & half after that. Verdict: Dont choose just because it has got good reviews. It is near to no tourist spot and the price you pay for it, can get you a descent accommodation in the city. I choose it because it has direct access to NUS. Choose this only if you feel like staying in a resort. Word of caution: Bathroom sleepers are supplied only if u ask for :) ????

Reviews.Title: “OK - must try harder”
Reviews.Author: Lee_in_Wokingham
Reviews.Content: A nice informal hotel in a great spot in Singapore. Away from the city but surrounded by restaurants and bars of Bukit Timah and Sixth Avenue. The rooms are clean and fairly comfortable, albeit a little basic, but given the room rate is fair, no problem. My only real gripe is the breakfast which borders on inedible. Tea ran out, although told 2 minutes, which after 15 minutes never appeared. I asked for a tea bag so i could make my own - no joy - no tea. Friday's breakfast offerings - Curried beans, something I can describe as left-over soggy pasta mixed with tuna?, deep fried chicken nuggests, soggy french toast and overcooked boiled eggs. Still, good for the diet eh? My advice, ask for a $10 discount on the room in return for no breakfast and walk the 20 metres to Picotin and buy breakfast there. Given I stay in alot of hotels in Singpare, it's a shame as I was feeling good about the lodge but the breakfast really blows. Still, on balance good to stay at with just a poor breakfast letting it down.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Lizards”
Reviews.Author: makaelya
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay for the first night. It is far from everything else, which means more money to be spent in taxi fares. The beds are very hard and uncomfortable. The bathroom smells of urine. The worst of all happened on the second day. As I was watching TV, I happened to see a lizard crawling on the wall. It took my breath away. This is rated as a 3 star hotel, and should be a one star. When I reported this to the staff they quickly had someone from housekeeping come to the room and get rid of the lizard, but when I said that I wanted to leave they told me that I couldn't get my money back, since it was after check-out time. I called hotels.com, since I made my reservations through them, and they couldn't do anything about it. The hotels.com representative called the hotel staff and was informed that the money would not be returned to me. Cancellation policies are not set by the representatives of 3rd party booking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you don't want the hussle and bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: jim1m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Riders Lodge for 2 nights and it was perfect for me. Located away from the city, but with bars and restaurants within walking distance, it is great for a quick stopover if your days are taken up with business. The rooms are adequately fitted out with flat screen tv, free wifi, and walk in shower (although I do hate shower curtains!). The breakfast is good, scrambled eggs, beans and sausages, croissants, pastries and fuit, you can't really ask for more.......and its served by the lawn which is a nice setting (if the dogs next door arn't barking!). A note on the dogs; didn't hear them in my room at all and they do seem quiet most of the time. Taxi's were easy to book through reception and cost about $20 to the airport. The bar Picotin is next door, serving good food and beer, inside and out, with a constant stream of football on the TV. Turf city is a 5 min walk away and provides loads of different restaurants and a massive supermarket. Overall was a nice experience, good for avoiding the city all together or just dipping into the city and then going back to for some peace.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: CenturionMkV
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at Rider's Lodge in September of 2009. It was my wife's first visit to Singapore and I had reservations about booking a hotel so far from Orchard road or a MRT station. It turned out to be a pretty good place to stay for the price charged. Where shall I start? Ok, this hotel is pretty far from where the action is in Singapore. Every day, we had to take a cab from the front of the hotel to the nearest MRT station (about a good five mile drive). Funny thing is, the taxi drivers do not know about this hotel, although they know about the old "horse track". If they don't know the exact location, just tell that that is by the old race track by Bukit Timah Road and they will know where to go. One way fare to and from the MRT station is about $5 to $7 SGD, which is VERY reasonable if you factor in the US$ exchange rate. Back to the hotel review... the staff go out of their way to make you happy. When our cab arrived at the hotel from the airport, the bell boy walked all the way to the cab (a good 30 meters) to get our bags. The concierge was very courteous, although their comprehension of conversational English can be improved. On the last day, the wake-up call was on the dot. We got a Grandeur room and it was fantastic. The room was on the ground floor, and is isolated from the rest of the building as it is at the tip of a "transept" that crosses the main building, akin to a European cathedral, for lack of a better description. The room thus juts into a lush green backyard lawn, away from the rest of the building. A nice tall window in the room gives you a generous view of the well manicured lawn and the tropical trees that occasionally have wild monkeys lounging lazily on the branches. At night, you can hear crickets chirping outside and there is a quiet ambiance in the entire compound. The interior decor of the room itself is modern yet restrained. Don't expect the ultra-modern furnishings from Orchard Road type boutique hotels. There is a flat screen TV that dominates the central wall and a nice desk in front of a large mirror. The bed is soft and gives you a quiet night's respite from a whole day of tourist activities. There is WIFI connection and it is FREE. There is also a nice closet with a mini safe for your passports and spare cash. If there is a complaint, that would be the size of the safe as it could have been bigger to accommodate a moderately sized laptop computer. There is a dead-bolt and a chain on the door to provide a good measure of security; not that the hotel is in a "bad" area, the whole place is smack in a upper middle class residential neighborhood and is VERY safe. The bathroom is perhaps the biggest detractor. There isn't a bath tub. You have a stand-up shower, similar to a high school locker room's. Soap (hair and body) is squirted from a dispenser similar to what you'd find in public bathrooms. On the other hand, everything is kept extremely CLEAN. Room service does a good job making sure that you find your room spotlessly clean every day and this is highly commendable! The air conditioning is god sent and provides a night of cool dry air for people not used to the humid tropical climate. The TV have many local stations and select cable stations including the Discovery Channel with shows you'd never find in the USA (we are so sick of watching yet another Orange County Choppers show back in the "states" and the TV programming is a welcome change.) Breakfast is unforgettable. Anyone who stayed at Rider's Lodge before can attest to the sound of dogs from the training compound right next to the hotel. The food is average, and I don't expect much from complimentary breakfast stuff anyway! For better food, a short walk down the street will take you to the local food court at the bottom of Giant Turf City. For first timers to Singapore, this short walk will give you a taste of what to expect out of the climate. Overall, a very good value for the price. Much better than many hotels I have stayed at in the same price range in the USA. I will recommend this to all weary travelers who are sick of the hustle bustle of Orchard Road and want to see a different side of Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Riders Lodge a not so expensive place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mknarula Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Grandeur Room. Booked the room from cleartrip. I visited this place in december 2009. First thing to observe is, the place is too far away from major attractions in singapore. Getting back to Riders Lodge at night is difficult. As far as I know there is no MRT service near this place. Buses to this place at night after 11 are not that frequent. I needed to checkout from hotel at 6 AM in the morning , it was raining that morning, it took me half hour to get the cab. There was no bath tub in the grandeur room. One irritating thing is that, there is a Dog training center near this place, a lot of disturbance occurs because of the dogs barking. The parking is chargeable, I think is S$ 3. The taxi will charge this amount, if you call it inside. I would recommend to ask the taxi to wait out and ask the hotel staff to help you to move the luggage. Staff is pretty polite, they helped with electrical adaptors, any transportation needs. The nearest bus stop is 5 minutes away walking. The direct buses are available to Little India, Orchard road, etc from the bus stop nearby. The breakfast was included in my hotel room charges. The breakfast is not that impressive. Fruits normally include banana. Cornflakes, cakes, tea, coffee are a part of daily menu. Two more items include one non vegetarian and one vegetarian item.

Reviews.Title: “No Privacy”
Reviews.Author: Davidvd
Reviews.Content: I attended a party at Rider's Lodge recently and had a bad impression of this place. My friend organised a party for one of her girlfriend and from the start we felt that the service was not good. 1. When collecting the keys, the manager told us no eating or drinking in the room. By the way we booked the suite. 2. When asked for a wine opener, the manager at the desk told us we can't consume alcohol. It seemed funny cos the room had a bar with beer and soft drinks inside. The room also came with a microwave oven. It seem rather odd when we were told not to consume any food or drink. 3. Ok so we gave in and didn't have our wine in the room. So came down to the buffet area to have our drink. The placed with infested with honey bees flying all over the place. When asked the manager if the hotel will be liable for our medical bill if we got stung by the bees, he didn't have an answer. 4, Finally while we were relexing in the room, we had a peeping tom. We were not sure if it was a hotel staff or another guest, but it just shocked us. A while later we get a call from the reception tell us to bring down our noise level. I am shocked by the rules of the hotel and would not recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for couples to relax.”
Reviews.Author: abigail22
Reviews.Content: I read a few comments for this hotel and still decided to give it a try. Both my husband & me would definitely give 2 thumbs up for this simple hotel after a night stay. We sort of lost our way getting there, so we called up the hotel and they were friendly & patient to guide us on the direction. The staffs are helpful & courteous. Checking-in were done very fast too. When we got in to our room, we were really pleased, cos the rooms are spacious & super clean especially the toilet. Not only that they had on the air-con and cooled the room for us before we get in. (very thoughtful act) Hotel is pretty near to Turf City, it's actually a 5 mins walk to Turf City, and everything you would need can be found in Turf City. It's not as some mentioned that it's far away, we did a slow stroll in the evening to Turf City not wanting to drive. It's good =) The only thing that I don't really like is the parking, there isn't any parking lots in the hotel itself, so we need to park our cars in the Horse city and charges there are pretty expensive. But overall it's a very nice experience for relaxation, would recommend for couples that want a short romantic getaway, but wouldn't really recommend for family with kids, cos hotel has no swimming pool only horse riding & basically not much of facilities in the hotel itself, so children may find it boring.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: LuvsComfort
Reviews.Content: I'm a retired American business professional with more than 20 years of world-wide business travel. I'm just finishing one week + at the Rider's Lodge in Singapore and I must say I've thoroughly enjoyed the experience. After reading the review of January 20, I felt I must present another opinion. The description provided by the hotel states:"It is an oasis of tranquility with country style lush green landscapes." and this is absolutely true. I was at once impressed and welcomed by the peaceful landscape and the clean lines of the lodge itself. Unlike the common hotel experience, the lobby is more like a comfortable lounge area, with a reception desk where you are seated while checking in. The reception staff are welcoming, courteous and efficient. I had planned on their standard room, but was upgraded to a "Grandeur" room at a special rate (S $140 nett). Now compare this to the economy room I stayed in for my first night. That room, in Chinatown, had no window at all. The room had a full-sized bed, but that was about all. As you get out of bed there is just barely room to stand without bumping the wall. Upgrade to a room with a window, but about the same size, is S $125. Internet is available in the lobby only at S $8 per day. At Rider's Lodge, for S $140 nett, I stayed in a spacious room, spotlessly clean, large desk/table with 3'x3' mirror, 32" lcd tv, 2 comfortable chairs, 2 nightstands with lamps on either side of a kingsize bed with 4 pillows. There is a nice sized closet with an electronic safe for small valuables. The bathroom is spacious enough, good pressure in the shower with electric heater. As the other reviewer commented, the toilet seat is similar to those found in hospitals, but so what? It is comfortable enough, the plumbing was efficient, and there is a personal spray device beside the toilet. And full-length bathrobes are provided. The room has a small mini-bar, apparently for convenience rather than indulgence. Tiger beer is the strongest alcoholic drink provided, but there is a moderate selection of soft drinks, water and snacks. As to location, it's true that it is not really convenient to buses or the mrt. However, this is offset by it's central location. Taxis are readily available by flagging them at the gate or by calling direct. Because of the location, anywhere in Singapore is a relatively low fare. Zoo is $10.20 each way. Lucky Plaza about $7. When that price is offset by 2 or more travellers, and the convenience or door to door comfort, it's really a bargain. I will admit the food at the lodge is not great. Breakfast is adequate if you stick to cereal, toast and juice. If you require more than that I hope you like Indian style dishes,,, I do not but of course that is personal taste only. If you are looking for room service, the alternative here is better than the room service provided by all but the best hotels. Looking on the internet with the fasr, free wifi internet service provided by the lodge, you find that there are dozens of restaurants, providing every style of food imaginable, at the same prices you would pay to eat in at the restaurant. Some deliver for free, some have a small delivery charge, which is always less than it would cost to go there and return. My experience was that the delivery speed and quality of the food equaled or exceeded that of most hotel room service. In summary, I believe this is a largely undiscovered gem of a hotel at a very reasonable price and in a great location. It's not an Oberoi (Bombay) or a Stakis (Scotland), but if you're looking for a quiet peaceful setting (even including the dog training facility next door), wonderful view, clean, spacious room with modern facilities, convenient location, then I highly recommend the Rider's Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Tranguility”
Reviews.Author: TashaCat9
Reviews.Content: I hope not everyone believe the one review that was rather unfairly written. I almost did. It was once again the time for my annual visit to Singapore. The hotel that I used to frequent during my annual visits was being bought over to make way, for yet another housing project, typical of the Singapore scene. A friend did a search and recommended Rider’s Lodge Hotel. Basing on her recommendation I confirmed my reservation for a stay of 22 days. A day before I was about to leave for Singapore, out of curiosity I decided to check out Rider’s Lodge Hotel reviews on the internet. There were some nice ones, but what struck me was this one review that almost made me cancel the bookings. I went …’Wow’….what did I get myself into, Twenty -Two days is a long time to be stuck in a place like that. Due to the time difference there was nothing I could do at that juncture. I decided I give it a one night stay and if it was that bad I can always find another hotel, when I am in Singapore. I arrived approximately 2.30am at hotel car-park, within less then a few seconds a porter was there to carry my luggage and less then 5 minutes, my registration of my stay was done. I found the room simply decorated but cosy and vey clean, bathroom was nice too and it touches me to see the little personnel toiletries provided. I like the air condition system because I could adjust accordingly to what temperature I wanted. The mini fridge kept my wine that I bought, cool and chilled Breakfast was included in the hotel package and it was very substantial. Food from room service was fine , it came serve on a plate with necessary utensils brought to me by one of the staff, like any other hotel do. Just across the car park, less then a minute walk was a nice restaurant, that serves breakfast, lunches and dinners and beautiful wine. I did the lunch and dinner there, food was good. The hotel it self as a unique look, the surroundings give a sense of peace and tranquility. The staff and management were absolutely marvelous. Courteous, polite and thoughtful, always a smile and so willing to help. I tried that one night and I stayed for the duration of 22 very pleasant days. I will definitely be coming back there again. I have also recommended some companies in Singapore for their overseas associates and etc. Suan Smith (Mrs) California, USA March 31st 2009

Reviews.Title: “Good Quiet Place to Escape the Bustle of the City”
Reviews.Author: matilda_chew
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had booked a Grandeur room for a night for my birthday. The lodge's in a nice location...just a short 5mins' walk from Dunearn Rd, yet in a quiet corner, so much so that it seems like we were in another place other than the ever busy and bustling Singapore! Our room was nicely furnished and spacious, with a good selection of channels on the TV. The room was clean and well-lit, unlike some of the hotels we've tried for similar prices here! The only drawback would be the very limited selection during breakfast, which we presumed had to be catered from outside, since the lodge doesn't have its own kitchen. Overall an enjoyable stay...with polite staff and a nicely maintained garden. I'd even enjoyed having the sounds of the dogs from the nearby dog training school going on at various points, and didn't find that a nuisance/ hindrance to my rest at all. The lodge is also quite exclusive, having not many rooms, and coupled with the location, it's a nice lil' place to escape the stifles of the Singaporean life minus the overseas expenses. Its decor is conventional, yet maintains the old-world loveliness of its original structure, and what the place was used for in the past. Like a lil' piece of heaven in the midst of relative nature.
